title: Kansas - Live In Chicago [1980] The Source
description:
Back in the early 80s a friend who was always trawling the record stores handed me this GEM knowing I was a great fan of Kansas.  It was two ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‹Å“white labelÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢ LPs  contained in a white cardboard sleeve.  There was no information at all.  These records however featured this fantastic Kansas concert which I can gather was recorded for Radio play.  The quality is excellent (almost as good as ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‹Å“Two For The ShowÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢) and many of the songs from ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‹Å“Audio VisionsÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢ are featured .

I commited the vinyl to Mini-Disc some time ago, editing out the few messages for some power tool, creating continuous play.  

Today I thought it was time to share this recording with other Kansas aficianados so I tranfered the Mini-Disc to CR-R ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‹Å“opticallyÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢ and then ripped it to WAV with Exact Audio Copy (EAC).

As Mini-Disc used a bit-rate of 256kbps (I believe) there was no point ripping to MP3 at anything higher so I chose 224kbps.  This I did using Nero file converter on the slowest, top setting.  Took ages.

Anyway, here are the results and I hope you enjoy the show as much as I do.  If anybody has more info about the recording I would love to know.







For Those Who Don&#039;t Know!

Kansas is an American progressive rock band which became a popular arena rock group in the 1970s, with hit singles such as "Carry On Wayward Son" and "Dust in the Wind". Kansas has remained a classic rock radio staple and a popular touring act in North America and Europe.
